intro: Vandellia erecta, commonly known as the erect vandellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as marshes and swamps. It has a short, stout stem with numerous branches and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Vandellia erecta is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique foliage and floral display.
